data.title: GRAHAM Group
data.meta_description:
GRAHAM Group | 70,473 followers on LinkedIn. Delivering lasting impact. | GRAHAM is a privately-owned company that specialises in the delivery of award-winning construction, civil engineering, interior fit-out, facilities management and investment projects. 

A truly national business, with an annual turnover of Â£1.094bn, GRAHAM operates from a network of 16 regional offices throughout the UK and Ireland, and employs over 2000 staff. 

Proudly â€œdelivering lasting impactâ€ since 1778, it is currently completing over 100 live projects across a range of key sectors including education, healthcare, commercial, retail, highways and rail.
data.text:
Delighted to be a Finalist in 2 categories: ğŸ“£ Digital Contractor of the Year Strategic technology upgrades and digital integration continuously improves efficiencies and project quality across our sites supported by a comprehensive digital upskilling program which has trained over 500 individuals, bolstering our digital competencies. Looking ahead, we aim to further integrate AI and supply chain technologies to support improved project delivery. ğŸ“£ Digital Construction Project of the Year The Clyde Waterfront regeneration scheme involved constructing a 184-metre opening road bridge over the River Clyde at Renfrew. We implemented biometric software for real-time site monitoring of this complex project, improving labour data tracking and saving time. A sophisticated Building Information Modelling (BIM) ensured a coordinated digital design, federating 40 separate models and automating information delivery. Drones were used for environmental and logistical surveys, enhancing accuracy and safety and the digital model facilitated 4D simulations and animations for stakeholder engagement, with 84 stakeholders trained on its applications. Wishing all finalists good luck on the night! #techfest2024 #constructionawards #digitalinnovation #deliveringlastingimpact Lorraine Harrison Construction News

Accurate and Robust Data: The Cornerstone of our Net Zero Strategy For the fourth consecutive year we have attained external verification of our GHG Emissions data via the Achilles Information Limited Carbon Reduce Scheme in accordance with ISO 14064-1:2018. âœ… Credible data remains an essential and critical element of our transition to net zero. âœ… It is the foundation for making carbon reduction decisions, allowing us to take targeted action to reduce the carbon associated with our business. âœ… Weâ€™re reporting 100% of our organisation's CO2e emissions across all scopes to ensure accurate and transparent carbon accounting. Lianne Taylor Achilles Information Limited #CarbonReduce #netzero #carbondisclosure #deliveringlastingimpact

ğ—–ğ—¡ ğ—ªğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—¸ğ—³ğ—¼ğ—¿ğ—°ğ—² ğ—”ğ˜„ğ—®ğ—¿ğ—±ğ˜€ ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—°ğ—¼ğ—´ğ—»ğ—¶ğ˜€ğ—² ğ—¼ğ˜‚ğ—¿ ğ˜€ğ—¼ğ—°ğ—¶ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ˜ƒğ—®ğ—¹ğ˜‚ğ—² ğ—¶ğ—ºğ—½ğ—®ğ—°ğ˜ Weâ€™re delighted to have been nominated by Construction News Workforce Awards for our social value impact in two categories: â€˜Outreach Initiative of the Yearâ€™ for GRAHAM Buildingâ€™s Beacon Programme and â€˜Social Value Initiative of the Yearâ€™ for GRAHAM Civil Engineeringâ€™s South Bank Quay project and GRAHAM Buildingâ€™s CRE8 initiative. âœ¨ The Beacon Programme is our SEND employer engagement pilot programme that was trialled in the Midlands. Its purpose was to support pupils with special educational needs and disabilities prepare for the world of work by providing them with work-based placements on our Birmingham Children's Hospital project. âœ¨ The South Bank Quay project delivered significant social value through job creation, skills development, and investment in the Teesside area. Achieving a Social and Economic Value of 177% against the original target, investing Â£188,000 in charities and local community groups, along with 227 hours of volunteering, 24 weeks of work placements and four apprenticeships to local young people. âœ¨ CRE8 is our pre-employment initiative that creates long-term job opportunities for local disadvantaged people. It involves training, site-based work experience, job opportunities and follow-on career advice â€“ making CRE8 the first wraparound initiative of its kind in construction. It has continued to evolve, recently being adopted by our GRAHAM Interior Fit-Out Division who delivered an Armed Forces targeted programme. We look forward to attending the awards ceremony in November in London â€“ good luck to all finalists. #Construction #CivilEngineering #CNWorkforce Steven Mackinder Louise Seddon Pam Green Gary Redpath Stephen Hughes

Hats off to Jane McCarron, Trainee Planner with GRAHAM Building! Jane recently returned from Canada upon completion of an â€˜Optimizing High Performance Building Designâ€™ course at Humber College in Toronto. Jane was selected to attend the course following an application and interview process, giving her the unique opportunity of learning from leading Professors in sustainability and high-performance buildings. While there she became Carbon Literacy Certified and developed a deeper understanding of the built environmentâ€™s role in supporting climate change mitigation, adaption, and resilience. She also gained extensive knowledge in the principles of Passivhaus and high-performance design techniques and how they can benefit the construction industry and society. To cap it all, she ended her trip by representing the students at the closing ceremony. We congratulate Jane on her success and know that this experience will only further enhance her studies as a Higher Level Apprentice in Construction Engineering with Surveying, and support the valuable contribution she makes to the GRAHAM team. #apprentice #construction #planning #teamGRAHAM South West College Ulster University Ray Ferguson

ğŸ“¢ GRAHAM consortium selected as preferred bidder for University of Manchester Fallowfield campus redevelopment ğŸ“¢ Viridis, a consortium of Equitix (infrastructure investor, developer and manager), GRAHAM Group (investor and contractor) and Derwent FM (facilities management), has been selected as preferred bidder and delivery partner for the redevelopment of the The University of Manchesterâ€™s Fallowfield Campus redevelopment under a Design, Build, Finance and Operate (DBFO) model. The redevelopment will create modern, high-quality, purpose-built student accommodation on the Fallowfield campus and will be the UKâ€™s largest student accommodation development. Dr Simon Merrywest, Director for the Student Experience at University of Manchester, said: â€œWe are delighted to have reached another key milestone in the progression of our plans for the Fallowfield Campus Redevelopment with the selection of Viridis as preferred bidder and our delivery partnerâ€¦â€ Andrew Bill, CEO at GRAHAM, said: â€œGRAHAM is delighted to be working in partnership with the University of Manchester to deliver its vision for the Fallowfield Residences Redevelopment Programme. Together, we will focus on creating an exemplar sustainable campus that will enhance the experience of the Universityâ€™s next generation of students.â€ Read more here: https://bit.ly/3LGxsJe #Investment #Construction #PBSA John McDonald Jonathan Hall Neil McFarlane

ğŸ“ƒ Contributing to Framework Strategic Alliance guide ğŸ“ƒ GRAHAM Group, who is a member of the Crown Commercial Service (CCS) Frameworkâ€™s Project Improvement Alliance Focus Group, was delighted to have helped draft a guidance document on strategic alliances. The purpose of the document is to support both clients and suppliers when considering and developing a strategic alliance through CCSâ€™s construction frameworks. Read â€˜A Guide To Framework Strategic Alliancingâ€™ here â¡ bit.ly/3YkmPTI Roseanne Edge MCIOB, National Framework Director at GRAHAM, said: â€œCollaboration is a cornerstone of project delivery. GRAHAM is committed to delivering projects for our clients in a collaborative manner. As such, we are delighted to have contributed to this guide to Framework Strategic Alliancing. Project Alliancing is already being used on schemes that we are delivering and provides demonstrable benefits to all parties. It has been good to collaborate with other CCS Alliance Members to develop this guide to assist others on the journey.â€ #PublicSector #Collaboration #Alliancing

Weâ€™ve been celebrating Pride across our sites and regional offices this summer as we celebrate diversity within the construction industry. Whilst the flags are a colourful addition to the grey skies of June, they symbolise the inclusive environments we aim to create through open dialogue and psychological safety. As a platinum member of Investors in People and IIP Wellbeing we push for diversity within our business and our industry, tackling homophobia and encouraging more LGBTQIA+ people to consider working in construction. Hollie M Cregan MIoL (she/her) Head of FIR at GRAHAM said: â€œWe take steps to ensure the environment in GRAHAM is reflective of the society in which we work. Respect is a core value and underpins our relationships with colleagues, partners, clients and the public. We continuously look to improve our workforce culture, ultimately creating a respectful, inclusive working environment for all.â€ As one of the UKâ€™s leading construction, fit out and FM companies, we are acutely aware of the need to champion Fairness, Inclusion & Respect in construction and help the industry develop inclusive workplace cultures. #construction #edi #pride2024

âœ¨ Finalist in six categories at CEF Awards âœ¨ GRAHAM Group is delighted to have been shortlisted in six categories at Construction Employers Federation (CEF) Excellence Awards 2024: â¡ Sustainable Company of the Year â¡ Excellence in the Use of Construction Technology â¡ Infrastructure Projects of the Year â€“ Transport & Utilities Infrastructure Project of the Year above Â£10m: York Street Redevelopment Project â¡ Health Project of the Year: Maternity Unit at Royal Victoria Hospital â¡ Social Value Project of the Year: Seagahan Clear Water Tank Project â¡ GB & ROI General Construction Projects of the Year â€“ Projects above Â£5m: Pall Mall Press Read more here: https://bit.ly/3xKFBZM #construction #civilengineering #CEFawards24 Lianne Taylor Andrew Crawford Lorraine Harrison John Deery Ciaran Moohan Jonathan Hall Peter Reavey Nick Williamson-Corbett

ğŸ“£We are thrilled to be shortlisted in 2 categories at the London Construction Awards: â¡ CONSTRUCTION SOFTWARE OF THE YEAR: GRAHAM-DESIGNED, SHE ONLINE PORTAL â¡ EXCELLENCE IN SUSTAINABILITY â€“ PROJECT: REARDON COURT Designed in-house by GRAHAM Group with an external software developer, our SHE reporting and analysis portal captures the timeous reporting of all incidents, observations and disciplines across the 3 strands of SHE. It facilitates due diligence and compliance auditing of all sites, as well as recording energy, fuel, waste and water usage to effectively monitor and manage our journey to net zero. Reardon Court is a new 70-unit residential care home led by Enfield Council. Procured via the Procure Partnerships Framework, the scheme provides affordable housing for older people in an assisted living facility, guaranteeing residents' independence, safety and comfort. Key sustainability initiatives to reduce carbon emissions included early connection to the grid, trialling new technology, the use of alternative fuels and sustainable design characteristics. Such is the success of our SHE portal, it has also been shortlisted in the upcoming Digital Construction Awards. Good luck to all finalists at both awards nights! Andrew Cooke Lianne Taylor Jonathan Hall Pat OHare Rob Joyce Moya Murton MCIOB #awards #construction #sustainability

ğ—–ğ—²ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—¯ğ—¿ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ—œğ—»ğ˜ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—»ğ—®ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»ğ—®ğ—¹ ğ—ªğ—¼ğ—ºğ—²ğ—» ğ—¶ğ—» ğ—˜ğ—»ğ—´ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—²ğ—²ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—»ğ—´ ğ——ğ—®ğ˜† ğŸ‰ To mark International Women in Engineering Day (23rd June) we are celebrating colleagues whose work in engineering has enhanced people's everyday lives in building a brighter future. Letâ€™s hear from Grace Jackson, Site Engineer, Beth Paterson, Building Site Engineer and Hannah Garrett, Building Services Manager. ğŸ“¢Grace achieved a well-deserved second place in the recent Institution of Civil Engineers (ICE) Emerging Engineers Award. Her award-winning presentation explored the evolving role of a modern engineer, highlighting the diverse skillset required to tackle society's pressing challenges. To ignite an interest in civil engineering among young people, Grace created an interactive quiz game, an engaging tool that allows them to discover the breadth of the role and serves as an inspiration for the next generation of engineers. ğŸ“¢Beth is a Building Site Engineer in Glasgow and joined GRAHAM in 2018 as an Apprentice Trainee Engineer. She has been involved in multiple projects during her time with the business including our recently completed Candleriggs Square Build-to-Rent development where she gained valuable experience that she will be able to transfer onto her next project at Bonnington Road in Edinburgh. ğŸ“¢Hannah began her career in site team administration, moved into computer-aided design (CAD), before settling on a career in engineering. She was sponsored through her degree, achieving BEng (Hons) while working. Hannah believes diversity and inclusion opens up better innovation in construction; introducing fresh voices allows new ways of looking at a problem and finding innovative solutions. The construction industry has moved forward greatly from when she joined it over fifteen years ago. As more women continue to enter the industry, more opportunities are available - helping to see the bigger picture of change for women engineers in construction. #INWED24 #womenengineers #celebrate GRAHAM Group GRAHAM Building GRAHAM Civil Engineering
